metadata.title: CVE-2021-27923 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properly checked for an ICO container, and thus an attempted memory allocation can be very large.

advisory.discovered_by: Jiayi Lin, Luke Shaffer, Xinran Xie, Akshay Ajayan

notes.note: mdeslaur> while this is mentioned in the 8.1.1 release notes, it doesn't seem to be mentioned in the CHANGES file, and I can't seem to locate the commits that fix this in 8.1.1 vs 8.1.0 This was actually fixed in 8.1.2.

criterions.comment: pillow package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1').
